channel.title: [Requesting] The best source, Editors such as map and sprite and a compiler
channel.description:
[b]Basically what the subject says but,
I basically just want all the things i'll need to create a server from such, As if i was going to create it from scratch and attempt to copy and achieve to create an exact copy of the original rsc. (This is just a description of what things i'll need, Probably won't go for that style of a server)
Just trying to get all the programs possible to make a full server.
I'd appreciate it alot of someone could help. By editors i mean all i can get not just map and sprite, Because i'm probably planning to change animations and stuff aswell.
If you suggest certain programs, Please link it or lead me to it.
Thanks, Mikkeh™[/b]

item.title: [Requesting] The best source, Editors such as map and sprite and a compiler

It makes sense you just to stupid to see the truth.

item.title: [Requesting] The best source, Editors such as map and sprite and a compiler
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Pick easy-rsc if you wan’t a quick easy to run server.

Pick rscd if you wan’t more organization (Mysql and having all that stuff done in LS).

Security is pretty much the same on both so you will end up having to patch things up anyways.

Read full topic
item.source: [Requesting] The best source, Editors such as map and sprite and a compiler

item.title: [Requesting] The best source, Editors such as map and sprite and a compiler
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote author=Mikkehhhh link=topic=433099.msg3179320#msg3179320 date=1271175786]What source do you use Kryptix?

RSCEmulation’s ‘source’ is based off RSCDaemon but to be honest I can’t think of a single class that hasn’t been changed/re-written. It’s really not a case of downloading a ‘source’ and running it.[/quote]

What did you edit in these?

Camera (client)
CameraModel (client)
CameraVariables (client)
DataEncryption (client)
DataFileDecrypter (client)
DataFileVariables (client)
DataOperations (client)
EngineHandle (client)
Model (client)
Everything in the package/subpackes of EntityHandling package (client)

If this doesn’t prove my point, then I’d be glad to do the same for the server portion…

Read full topic
